get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain account summary information.

spotSubQuantity.description: Number of sub-accounts with spot trading permissions enabled

marginSubQuantity.description: Number of sub-accounts with margin trading permissions enabled

futuresSubQuantity.description: Number of sub-accounts with futures trading permissions enabled

optionSubQuantity.description: Number of sub-accounts with option trading permissions enabled

maxSubQuantity.description: Max. number of sub-accounts = maxDefaultSubQuantity + maxSpotSubQuantity

maxDefaultSubQuantity.description: Max. number of default open sub-accounts (according to VIP level)

maxSpotSubQuantity.description: Max. number of sub-accounts with additional spot trading permissions

maxMarginSubQuantity.description: Max. number of sub-accounts with additional margin trading permissions

maxFuturesSubQuantity.description: Max. number of sub-accounts with additional futures trading permissions

maxOptionSubQuantity.description: Max. number of sub-accounts with additional option trading permissions

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to obtain account summary information.

get.description: Get the api key information. Use the api key awaiting checking to call the endpoint. Both master and sub user's api key are applicable.

permission.description: [Permissions](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338144),  possible values: General, Spot, Margin, Futures, InnerTransfer, Transfer, Earn

isMaster.description: Whether it is the master account.

subName.description: Sub Name, There is no such param for the master account

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get the api key information. Use the api key awaiting checking to call the endpoint. Both master and sub user's api key are applicable.

get.description: This interface determines whether the current user is a spot high-frequency user or a spot low-frequency user.

data.description: Spot account type. True means the current user is a high-frequency spot user, False means the current user is a low-frequency spot user

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface determines whether the current user is a spot high-frequency user or a spot low-frequency user.

get.description: Get a list of accounts. Please deposit funds into the main account first, then use the Transfer function to move them to the trade account before trading.

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use)

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get a list of accounts. Please deposit funds into the main account first, then use the Transfer function to move them to the trade account before trading.

get.description: Get information for a single spot account. Use this endpoint when you know the accountId.

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use)

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get information for a single spot account. Use this endpoint when you know the accountId.

get.description: Request cross margin account info via this endpoint.

parameters.name: quoteCurrency
parameters.description: quote currency, currently only supports USDT, KCS, BTC, USDT as default

parameters.name: queryType
parameters.description: Query account type (default MARGIN), MARGIN - only query low frequency cross margin account, MARGIN_V2-only query high frequency cross margin account, ALL - consistent aggregate query with the web side

status.description: Position status; EFFECTIVE-effective, BANKRUPTCY-bankruptcy liquidation, LIQUIDATION-closing, REPAY-repayment, BORROW-borrowing

maxBorrowSize.description: The user's remaining maximum loan amount

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request cross margin account info via this endpoint.

get.description: Request isolated margin account info via this endpoint.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: For isolated trading pairs, query all without passing

parameters.name: quoteCurrency
parameters.description: quote currency, currently only supports USDT, KCS, BTC, USDT as default

parameters.name: queryType
parameters.description: Query account type (default ISOLATED), ISOLATED- - only query low frequency isolated margin account, ISOLATED_V2-only query high frequency isolated margin account, ALL - consistent aggregate query with the web side

status.description: Position status; EFFECTIVE-effective, BANKRUPTCY-bankruptcy liquidation, LIQUIDATION-closing, REPAY-repayment, BORROW-borrowing

maxBorrowSize.description: The user's remaining maximum loan amount
The user's remaining maximum loan amount

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request isolated margin account info via this endpoint.

get.description: Request futures account info via this endpoint.

marginBalance.description: Margin balance = positionMargin + orderMargin + frozenFunds + availableBalance - unrealizedPNL

maxWithdrawAmount.description: Maximum amount that can be withdrawn/transferred.

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request futures account info via this endpoint.

get.description: This interface is for transaction records from all your account types, supporting various currency inquiries. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency (you can choose more than one currency). You can specify a max. of 10 currencies in one go. If not specified, all currencies will be queried by default.

parameters.name: bizType
parameters.description: Type: DEPOSIT-deposit, WITHDRAW-withdraw, TRANSFER-transfer, SUB_TRANSFER-sub-account transfer, TRADE_EXCHANGE-trade, MARGIN_EXCHANGE-margin trade, KUCOIN_BONUS-bonus, BROKER_TRANSFER-Broker transfer record

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 10, maximum is 500.

amount.description: The total amount of assets (fees included) involved in assets changes such as transactions, withdrawals and bonus distributions.

fee.description: Fees generated in transaction, withdrawal, etc.

balance.description: Remaining funds after the transaction. (Deprecated field, no actual use of the value field)

accountType.description: Master user account types: MAIN, TRADE, MARGIN or CONTRACT.

bizType.description: Business type leading to changes in funds, such as exchange, withdrawal, deposit, KUCOIN_BONUS, REFERRAL_BONUS, Lendings etc.

context.description: Business related information such as order ID, serial no., etc.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is for transaction records from all your account types, supporting various currency inquiries. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

get.description: This API endpoint returns all transfer (in and out) records in high-frequency trading accounts and supports multi-coin queries. The query results are sorted in descending order by createdAt and ID.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency (you can choose more than one currency). You can specify a max. of 10 currencies in one go. If not specified, all currencies will be queried by default.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description: The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.

balance.description: Total balance of funds after change

bizType.description: Trnasaction type, such as TRANSFER, TRADE_EXCHANGE, etc.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This API endpoint returns all transfer (in and out) records in high-frequency trading accounts and supports multi-coin queries. The query results are sorted in descending order by createdAt and ID.

get.description: This API endpoint returns all transfer (in and out) records in high-frequency margin trading accounts and supports multi-coin queries. The query results are sorted in descending order by createdAt and ID.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency optional; more than one can be selected; separate using commas; select no more than 10 currencies; the default will be to query for all currencies if left empty

parameters.name: bizType
parameters.description: Transaction type: TRANSFER- transfer funds, MARGIN_EXCHANGE-cross margin trade, ISOLATED_EXCHANGE-isolated margin trade, LIQUIDATION-liquidation, ASSERT_RETURN-forced liquidation asset return

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description: The ID of the last set of data from the previous data batch. By default, the latest information is given.

balance.description: Total balance of funds after change

bizType.description: Trnasaction type, such as TRANSFER, TRADE_EXCHANGE, etc.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This API endpoint returns all transfer (in and out) records in high-frequency margin trading accounts and supports multi-coin queries. The query results are sorted in descending order by createdAt and ID.

get.description: This interface can query the ledger records of the futures business line.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency of transaction history, XBT or USDT

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type RealizedPNL-Realized profit and loss, Deposit-Deposit, Withdrawal-withdraw, Transferin-Transfer in, TransferOut-Transfer out

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start offset. Generally, only the attributes of the last returned result of the previous request are used, and the first page is returned by default

parameters.name: forward
parameters.description: This parameter functions to judge whether the lookup is forward or not. True means “yes” and False means “no”. This parameter is set as true by default.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: Displayed size per page. The default size is 50

type.description: Type: RealisedPNL, Deposit, Withdrawal, TransferIn, TransferOut

hasMore.description: Is it the last page? If it is false, it means it is the last page, and if it is true, it means you need to move to the next page.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can query the ledger records of the futures business line.

post.description: This endpoint can be used to create sub-accounts.
post.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to create sub-accounts.

password.description: Password (7–24 characters, must contain letters and numbers, cannot only contain numbers or include special characters)

subName.description: Sub-account name (must contain 7–32 characters, at least one number and one letter. Cannot contain any spaces.)

access.description: Permission (types include Spot, Futures, Margin permissions, which can be used alone or in combination).

post.description: This endpoint can be used to add sub-account Margin permissions. Before using this endpoint, you need to ensure that the master account apikey has Margin permissions and the Margin function has been activated.
post.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to add sub-account Margin permissions. Before using this endpoint, you need to ensure that the master account apikey has Margin permissions and the Margin function has been activated.

post.description: This endpoint can be used to add sub-account Futures permissions. Before using this endpoint, you need to ensure that the master account apikey has Futures permissions and the Futures function has been activated.
post.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to add sub-account Futures permissions. Before using this endpoint, you need to ensure that the master account apikey has Futures permissions and the Futures function has been activated.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to get a paginated list of sub-accounts. Pagination is required.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 1, maximum is 100, default is 10.

pageSize.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 1, maximum is 100

openedTradeTypes.description: Sub-account active permissions: If you do not have the corresponding permissions, you must log in to the sub-account and go to the corresponding web page to activate.

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to get a paginated list of sub-accounts. Pagination is required.

parameters.description: false: do not display the currency which asset is 0, true: display all currency

parameters.name: baseCurrency
parameters.description: Specify the currency used to convert assets

parameters.name: baseAmount
parameters.description: Specify the currency balance must be greater than or equal to the amount

subUserId.description: The user ID of a sub-user.

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade.

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use).

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade.

frozenFundsTotal.description: Total frozen funds for withdrawal and out-transfer

accountName.description: Account name, main account is main

post.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to create APIs for sub-accounts.

passphrase.description: Password (Must contain 7–32 characters. Cannot contain any spaces.)

permission.description: [Permissions](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338144)(Only General, Spot, Futures, Margin, InnerTransfer (Flex Transfer) permissions can be set, such as "General, Trade". The default is "General")

ipWhitelist.description: IP whitelist (You may add up to 20 IPs. Use a halfwidth comma to each IP)

subName.description: Sub-account name, create sub account name of API Key.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain a list of APIs pertaining to a sub-account (not including ND broker sub-accounts).

passphrase.description: Password (Must contain 7–32 characters. Cannot contain any spaces.)

permission.description: [Permissions](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338144)(Only General, Spot, Futures, Margin, InnerTransfer (Flex Transfer) permissions can be set, such as "General, Trade". The default is "General")

ipWhitelist.description: IP whitelist (You may add up to 20 IPs. Use a halfwidth comma to each IP)

subName.description: Sub-account name, create sub account name of API Key.

post.description: Request via this endpoint the creation of a deposit address for a currency you intend to deposit.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

to.description: Deposit account type: MAIN (funding account), TRADE (spot trading account)

expirationDate.description: Expiration time; Lightning network expiration time; this field is not applicable to non-Lightning networks

post.x-sdk-method-description: Request via this endpoint the creation of a deposit address for a currency you intend to deposit.

chain.description: The chainId of currency, e.g. the available values for USDT are OMNI, ERC20, and TRC20; default is ERC20. The available values for BTC are Native, Segwit, TRC20; the parameters are bech32, btc, trx; default is Native.

to.description: Deposit account type: MAIN (funding account), TRADE (spot trading account); the default is MAIN

amount.description: Deposit amount. This parameter is only used when applying for invoices on the Lightning Network. This parameter is invalid if it is not passed through the Lightning Network.

get.description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Deposit amount. This parameter is only used when applying for invoices on the Lightning Network. This parameter is invalid if it is not passed through the Lightning Network.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

to.description: Deposit account type: MAIN(funding account), TRADE (spot trading account)

expirationDate.description: Expiration time; Lightning network expiration time; this field is not applicable to non-Lightning networks

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

get.description: Request a deposit list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status. Available value: PROCESSING, SUCCESS, and FAILURE

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 10, maximum is 500.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty.

createdAt.description: Creation time of the database record

updatedAt.description: Update time of the database record

arrears.description: Whether there is any debt.A quick rollback will cause the deposit to fail. If the deposit fails, you will need to repay the balance.

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request a deposit list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

    "code": "200000",

        "pageSize": 50,
        "totalNum": 5,
        "totalPage": 1,
        "items": [
            {
                "currency": "USDT",
                "chain": "",
                "status": "SUCCESS",
                "address": "a435*****@gmail.com",
                "memo": "",
                "isInner": true,
                "amount": "1.00000000",
                "fee": "0.00000000",
                "walletTxId": null,
                "createdAt": 1728555875000,
                "updatedAt": 1728555875000,
                "remark": "",
                "arrears": false
            },
            {
                "currency": "USDT",
                "chain": "trx",
                "status": "SUCCESS",
                "address": "TSv3L1fS7******X4nLP6rqNxYz",
                "memo": "",
                "isInner": true,
                "amount": "6.00000000",
                "fee": "0.00000000",
                "walletTxId": null,
                "createdAt": 1721730920000,
                "updatedAt": 1721730920000,
                "remark": "",
                "arrears": false
            }
        ]
    }
}

get.description: This interface can obtain the withdrawal quota information of this currency.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chainId of currency, e.g. the available values for USDT are OMNI, ERC20, and TRC20; default is ERC20. The available values for BTC are Native, Segwit, TRC20; the parameters are bech32, btc, trx; default is Native. This only applies to multi-chain currencies; no need for single-chain currencies.

limitQuotaCurrencyAmount.description: The intraday available withdrawal amount (withdrawal limit currency)

usedQuotaCurrencyAmount.description: The intraday cumulative withdrawal amount (withdrawal limit currency)

remainAmount.description: Remaining amount available to withdraw the current day

lockedAmount.description: Total locked amount (including the amount locked into USDT for each currency)

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can obtain the withdrawal quota information of this currency.

post.description: Use this interface to withdraw the specified currency.

withdrawalId.description: Withdrawal id, a unique ID for a withdrawal

post.x-sdk-method-description: Use this interface to withdraw the specified currency.

chain.description: The chainId of currency, For a currency with multiple chains, it is recommended to specify the chain parameter instead of using the default chain; you can query the chainId through the response of the GET /api/v3/currencies/{currency} interface.

amount.description: Withdrawal amount, a positive number which is a multiple of the amount precision

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

isInner.description: Internal withdrawal or not. Default: False

feeDeductType.description:
Withdrawal fee deduction type: INTERNAL, EXTERNAL, or not specified

1. INTERNAL: Deduct the transaction fees from your withdrawal amount
2. EXTERNAL: Deduct the transaction fees from your main account
3. If you don't specify the feeDeductType parameter, when the balance in your main account is sufficient to support the withdrawal, the system will initially deduct the transaction fees from your main account. But if the balance in your main account is not sufficient to support the withdrawal, the system will deduct the fees from your withdrawal amount. For example: Suppose you are going to withdraw 1 BTC from the KuCoin platform (transaction fee: 0.0001BTC), if the balance in your main account is insufficient, the system will deduct the transaction fees from your withdrawal amount. In this case, you will be receiving 0.9999BTC.

withdrawType.description: Withdrawal type, ADDRESS (withdrawal address), UID, MAIL (email), PHONE (mobile phone number). Note: If you withdraw by uid/mail/phone, there will be rate limits: 3 times/10 seconds, 50 times/24 hours (calculated on a rolling basis based on the first request time)

delete.description: This interface can cancel the withdrawal. Only withdrawal requests with PROCESSING status can be canceled.

parameters.name: withdrawalId
parameters.description: Path parameter, a unique ID for a withdrawalId

delete.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can cancel the withdrawal. Only withdrawal requests with PROCESSING status can be canceled.

get.description: Request a withdrawal list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status. Available value: REVIEW, PROCESSING, WALLET_PROCESSING, SUCCESS and FAILURE

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 10, maximum is 500.

status.description: Status. Available value: REVIEW, PROCESSING, WALLET_PROCESSING, SUCCESS and FAILURE

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty.

updatedAt.description: Update time of the database record

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request a withdrawal list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

{

    "data": {

        "totalPage": 1,
        "items": [
            {
                "currency": "USDT",

                "status": "SUCCESS",
                "address": "a435*****@gmail.com",
                "memo": "",
                "isInner": true,
                "amount": "1.00000000",
                "fee": "0.00000000",
                "walletTxId": null,
                "createdAt": 1728555875000,
                "updatedAt": 1728555875000,
                "remark": "",
                "arrears": false
            },
            {
                "currency": "USDT",
                "chain": "trx",
                "status": "SUCCESS",
                "address": "TSv3L1fS7******X4nLP6rqNxYz",
                "memo": "",
                "isInner": true,
                "amount": "6.00000000",
                "fee": "0.00000000",
                "walletTxId": null,
                "createdAt": 1721730920000,
                "updatedAt": 1721730920000,
                "remark": "",
                "arrears": false
            }
        ]
    }
}

post.description: Use this interface to withdraw the specified currency.

withdrawalId.description: Withdrawal id, a unique ID for a withdrawal

post.x-sdk-method-description: Use this interface to withdraw the specified currency.

chain.description: The chainId of currency, For a currency with multiple chains, it is recommended to specify the chain parameter instead of using the default chain; you can query the chainId through the response of the GET /api/v3/currencies/{currency} interface.

amount.description: Withdrawal amount, a positive number which is a multiple of the amount precision

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

isInner.description: Internal withdrawal or not. Default: False

feeDeductType.description:
Withdrawal fee deduction type: INTERNAL, EXTERNAL, or not specified

1. INTERNAL: Deduct the transaction fees from your withdrawal amount
2. EXTERNAL: Deduct the transaction fees from your main account
3. If you don't specify the feeDeductType parameter, when the balance in your main account is sufficient to support the withdrawal, the system will initially deduct the transaction fees from your main account. But if the balance in your main account is not sufficient to support the withdrawal, the system will deduct the fees from your withdrawal amount. For example: Suppose you are going to withdraw 1 BTC from the KuCoin platform (transaction fee: 0.0001BTC), if the balance in your main account is insufficient, the system will deduct the transaction fees from your withdrawal amount. In this case, you will be receiving 0.9999BTC.

get.description: This endpoint returns the transferable balance of a specified account.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The account type:MAIN, TRADE, MARGIN, ISOLATED, MARGIN_V2, ISOLATED_V2

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Trading pair required when the account type is ISOLATED; other types do not pass, e.g.: BTC-USDT

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade.

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use).

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint returns the transferable balance of a specified account.

post.description: This interface can be used for transfers between master- and sub-accounts and transfers
post.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can be used for transfers between master- and sub-accounts and transfers

clientOid.description: Unique order ID created by users to identify their orders, e.g. UUID, with a maximum length of 128 bits

amount.description: Transfer amount: The amount is a positive integer multiple of the currency precision.

fromUserId.description: Transfer out UserId: This is required when transferring from sub-account to master-account. It is optional for internal transfers.

fromAccountType.description: Account type: MAIN, TRADE, CONTRACT, MARGIN, ISOLATED, MARGIN_V2, ISOLATED_V2

fromAccountTag.description: Symbol: Required when the account type is ISOLATED or ISOLATED_V2, for example: BTC-USDT

type.description: Transfer type: INTERNAL (Transfer within account), PARENT_TO_SUB (Transfer from master-account to sub-account), SUB_TO_PARENT (Transfer from sub-account to master-account)

toUserId.description: Transfer in UserId: This is required when transferring master-account to sub-account. It is optional for internal transfers.

toAccountType.description: Account type: MAIN, TRADE, CONTRACT, MARGIN, ISOLATED, MARGIN_V2, ISOLATED_V2

toAccountTag.description: Symbol: Required when the account type is ISOLATED or ISOLATED_V2, for example: BTC-USDT

get.description: This interface is for the user’s spot/margin basic fee rate.

parameters.name: currencyType
parameters.description: Currency type: 0-crypto currency, 1-fiat currency. Default is 0-crypto currency

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is for the user’s spot/margin basic fee rate.

get.description: This interface is for the trading pair’s actual fee rate. You can inquire about fee rates of 10 trading pairs each time at most. The fee rate of your sub-account is the same as that of the master account.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Trading pair (optional; you can inquire fee rates of 10 trading pairs each time at most)

symbol.description: The unique identity of the trading pair; will not change even if the trading pair is renamed

takerFeeRate.description: Actual taker fee rate of the symbol

makerFeeRate.description: Actual maker fee rate of the symbol

sellTaxRate.description: Buy tax rate, This field is visible to users in certain countries

buyTaxRate.description: Sell tax rate, This field is visible to users in certain countries

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is for the trading pair’s actual fee rate. You can inquire about fee rates of 10 trading pairs each time at most. The fee rate of your sub-account is the same as that of the master account.

patch.description: This interface is for the trading pair’s actual futures fee rate. The fee rate of your sub-account is the same as that of the master account.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The unique identity of the trading pair; will not change even if the trading pair is renamed

symbol.description: The unique identity of the trading pair; will not change even if the trading pair is renamed

takerFeeRate.description: Actual taker fee rate of the trading pair

makerFeeRate.description: Actual maker fee rate of the trading pair

patch.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is for the trading pair’s actual futures fee rate. The fee rate of your sub-account is the same as that of the master account.

get.description: You can get the user info of all sub-account via this interface; it is recommended to use the GET /api/v2/sub/user interface for paging query

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use).

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade.

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use).

available.description: Funds available to withdraw or trade.

holds.description: Funds on hold (not available for use).

tradeHFAccounts.description: This param is deprecated and only valid for some old users

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint returns the account info of all sub-users.

get.description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

to.description: Deposit account type: main (funding account), trade (spot trading account)

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

post.description: Funds in the main account, trading account and margin account of a Master Account can be transferred to the main account, trading account, futures account and margin account of its Sub-Account. The futures account of both the Master Account and Sub-Account can only accept funds transferred in from the main account, trading account and margin account and cannot transfer out to these accounts.
post.x-sdk-method-description: Funds in the main account, trading account and margin account of a Master Account can be transferred to the main account, trading account, futures account and margin account of its Sub-Account. The futures account of both the Master Account and Sub-Account can only accept funds transferred in from the main account, trading account and margin account and cannot transfer out to these accounts.

clientOid.description: Unique order ID created by users to identify their orders, e.g. UUID, with a maximum length of 128 bits

amount.description: Transfer amount: The amount is a positive integer multiple of the currency precision.

direction.description:
OUT — the master user to sub user
IN — the sub user to the master user

accountType.description: Account type: MAIN, TRADE, CONTRACT, MARGIN, ISOLATED

subAccountType.description: Sub-account type: MAIN, TRADE, CONTRACT, MARGIN, ISOLATED

subUserId.description: the user ID of a sub-account.

tag.description: Need to be defined if accountType=ISOLATED.

subTag.description: Need to be defined if subAccountType=ISOLATED.

post.description: This API endpoint can be used to transfer funds between accounts internally. Users can transfer funds between their accounts free of charge.
post.x-sdk-method-description: This API endpoint can be used to transfer funds between accounts internally. Users can transfer funds between their accounts free of charge.

clientOid.description: Unique order ID created by users to identify their orders, e.g. UUID, with a maximum length of 128 bits

amount.description: Transfer amount: The amount is a positive integer multiple of the currency precision.

to.description: Receiving Account Type: main, trade, margin, isolated, margin_v2, isolated_v2, contract

fromTag.description: Trading pair, required when the payment account type is isolated, e.g.: BTC-USDT

toTag.description: Trading pair, required when the payment account type is isolated, e.g.: BTC-USDT

from.description: Payment Account Type: main, trade, margin, isolated, margin_v2, isolated_v2

post.description: The amount to be transferred will be deducted from the KuCoin Futures Account. Please ensure that you have sufficient funds in your KuCoin Futures Account, or the transfer will fail.

status.description: Status:APPLY, PROCESSING, PENDING_APPROVAL, APPROVED, REJECTED, PENDING_CANCEL, CANCEL, SUCCESS

post.x-sdk-method-description: The amount to be transferred will be deducted from the KuCoin Futures Account. Please ensure that you have sufficient funds in your KuCoin Futures Account, or the transfer will fail.

amount.description: Amount to be transferred out; cannot exceed 1000000000

recAccountType.description: Receive account type, including MAIN, TRADE

post.description: The amount to be transferred will be deducted from the payAccount. Please ensure that you have sufficient funds in your payAccount account, or the transfer will fail.
post.x-sdk-method-description: The amount to be transferred will be deducted from the payAccount. Please ensure that you have sufficient funds in your payAccount account, or the transfer will fail.

payAccountType.description: Payment account type, including MAIN, TRADE

get.description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: The chainId of currency, e.g. the available values for USDT are OMNI, ERC20, and TRC20; default is ERC20. The available values for BTC are Native, Segwit, TRC20; the parameters are bech32, btc, trx; default is Native. This only applies to multi-chain currencies; no need for single-chain currencies.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

to.description: Deposit account type: main (funding account), trade (spot trading account)

get.x-sdk-method-description: Get all deposit addresses for the currency you intend to deposit. If the returned data is empty, you may need to add the deposit address first.

post.description: Request via this endpoint the creation of a deposit address for a currency you intend to deposit.

memo.description: Address remark. If there’s no remark, it is empty. When you withdraw from other platforms to KuCoin, you need to fill in memo(tag). Be careful: If you do not fill in memo(tag), your deposit may not be available.

to.description: Deposit account type: main (funding account), trade (spot trading account)

post.x-sdk-method-description: Request via this endpoint the creation of a deposit address for a currency you intend to deposit.

chain.description: The chainId of currency, e.g. the available values for USDT are OMNI, ERC20, and TRC20; default is ERC20. The available values for BTC are Native, Segwit, TRC20; the parameters are bech32, btc, trx; default is Native. This only applies to multi-chain currencies; no need for single-chain currencies.

to.description: Deposit account type: main (funding account), trade (spot trading account); the default is main

get.description: Request the V1 historical deposits list on KuCoin via this endpoint. The return value is the data after Pagination, sorted in descending order according to time.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status. Available value: PROCESSING, SUCCESS, and FAILURE

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request the V1 historical deposits list on KuCoin via this endpoint. The return value is the data after Pagination, sorted in descending order according to time.

get.summary: Get Futures Account Transfer Out Ledger
get.description: Futures account transfer out ledgers can be obtained at this endpoint.

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current request page. The default currentPage is 1

get.x-sdk-method-description: Futures account transfer out ledgers can be obtained at this endpoint.

get.description: Request a deposit list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status. Available value: PROCESSING, SUCCESS, and FAILURE

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results per request. Minimum is 10, maximum is 500.

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request a deposit list via this endpoint. Items are paginated and sorted to show the latest first. See the Pagination section for retrieving additional entries after the first page.

get.description: Request margin account info via this endpoint.

holdBalance.description: Funds on hold in the account

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request margin account info via this endpoint.

get.summary: Get Account List - Isolated Margin - V1
get.description: Request the isolated margin account info list via this endpoint.

parameters.name: balanceCurrency
parameters.description: quote currency, currently only supports USDT, KCS, BTC, USDT as default

totalConversionBalance.description: The total balance of the isolated margin account (in the request coin)

liabilityConversionBalance.description: Total liabilities of the isolated margin account (in the request coin)

status.description: Position status: Existing liabilities-DEBT, No liabilities-CLEAR, Bankrupcy (after position enters a negative balance)-BANKRUPTCY, Existing borrowings-IN_BORROW, Existing repayments-IN_REPAY, Under liquidation-IN_LIQUIDATION, Under auto-renewal assets-IN_AUTO_RENEW .

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request the isolated margin account info list via this endpoint.

get.summary: Get Account Detail - Isolated Margin - V1
get.description: Request isolated margin account info via this endpoint.

status.description: Position status: Existing liabilities-DEBT, No liabilities-CLEAR, Bankrupcy (after position enters a negative balance)-BANKRUPTCY, Existing borrowings-IN_BORROW, Existing repayments-IN_REPAY, Under liquidation-IN_LIQUIDATION, Under auto-renewal assets-IN_AUTO_RENEW .

get.x-sdk-method-description: Request isolated margin account info via this endpoint.
